description: Gateshead hold off a late comeback from north east rivals Hartlepool United to win 4-3 and remain fourth in the National League.
title: Gateshead 4-3 Hartlepool United
title_page: Gateshead 4-3 Hartlepool United: Heed hold off late comeback to stay fourth - BBC Sport
maintext:
Gateshead survived a late fightback to beat Hartlepool United 4-3 after a dramatic finish at the International Stadium.
The hosts appeared to be cruising after the second of Tyrelle Newton's goals had put them 3-1 up on the hour mark.
But veteran striker Gary Madine pulled one back with an 84th minute effort, and although Owen Oseni restored Gateshead's two-goal advantage two minutes later, Madine then struck again in stoppage time to test home nerves.
Newton had put Gateshead in front in the 18th minute before a fine strike from Ben Worman doubled the hosts' advantage just after the half-hour.
Hartlepool pulled a goal back seconds later through Joe Grey's curling effort before Worman set up Newton's second ahead of the late drama.
